abstract.text: Provides a convenient method for backporting API,
including types, functions, properties, property wrappers and more.

inlineContent.text: To backport a SwiftUI Label for example, you could apply the
Now if we want to provide further extensions to our backport type,
we need to ensure we retain the

code: extension Backport.Label where Content == Any, Title == Text, Icon == Image {
public init<S: StringProtocol>(_ title: S, systemName: String) { }

inlineContent.text: In addition to types, we can also provide backports for properties

code: func onChange<Value: Equatable>(of value: Value, perform action: (Value) -> Void) -> some View {
// `content` provides access to the extended type
